title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient
name: BigQueryClient
description:
Google Cloud BigQuery allows you to create, manage, share and query data.

Find more information at the Google Cloud BigQuery Docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache for storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

params.name: config.returnInt64AsObject
params.description: If true, 64 bit integers will be returned as a Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 object for 32 bit platform compatibility. Defaults to false.

methods.name: runQuery
methods.description:
Runs a BigQuery SQL query in a synchronous fashion. Rows are returned immediately as long as the query completes within a specified timeout. In the case that the query does not complete in the specified timeout, you are able to poll the query's status until it is complete.

Queries constructed using standard SQL can take advantage of parametriziation.

Refer to the table below for a guide on how parameter types are mapped to their BigQuery equivalents.

PHP Type BigQuery Data Type
\DateTimeInterface DATETIME
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Bytes BYTES
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Date DATE
Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 INT64
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Time TIME
Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Timestamp TIMESTAMP
Associative Array STRUCT
Non-Associative Array ARRAY
float FLOAT64
int INT64
string STRING
resource BYTES
bool BOOL
object (Outside types specified above) ERROR InvalidArgumentException

examples.caption: Construct a query utilizing named parameters.
Construct a query utilizing positional parameters.

params.name: query
params.description: A BigQuery SQL query.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of rows to return per page of results. Setting this flag to a small value such as 1000 and then paging through results might improve reliability when the query result set is large.

params.name: options.defaultDataset
params.description: Specifies the default datasetId and projectId to assume for any unqualified table names in the query. If not set, all table names in the query string must be qualified in the format 'datasetId.tableId'.

params.name: options.timeoutMs
params.description: How long to wait for the query to complete, in milliseconds. Defaults to 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds).

params.name: options.useQueryCache
params.description: Whether to look for the result in the query cache.

params.name: options.useLegacySql
params.description: Specifies whether to use BigQuery's legacy SQL dialect for this query. Defaults to true. If set to false, the query will use BigQuery's standard SQL.

params.name: options.parameters
params.description: Only available for standard SQL queries. When providing a non-associative array positional parameters (?) will be used. When providing an associative array named parameters will be used (@name).

methods.name: runQueryAsJob
methods.description:
Runs a BigQuery SQL query in an asynchronous fashion. Running a query in this fashion requires you to poll for the status before being able to access results.

Queries constructed using standard SQL can take advantage of parametriziation. For more details and examples please see Google\Cloud\BigQuery\BigQueryClient::runQuery().

params.name: query
params.description: A BigQuery SQL query.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.parameters
params.description: Only available for standard SQL queries. When providing a non-associative array positional parameters (?) will be used. When providing an associative array named parameters will be used (@name).

params.name: options.jobConfig
params.description: Configuration settings for a query job are outlined in the API Docs for configuration.query. If not provided default settings will be used.

methods.name: job
methods.description: Lazily instantiates a job. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a job please see Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Job.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the job to request.

examples.caption: Get all jobs with the state of 'done'

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.allUsers
params.description: Whether to display jobs owned by all users in the project. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per page.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

params.name: options.stateFilter
params.description: Filter for job state. Maybe be either done, pending, or running.

methods.name: dataset
methods.description: Lazily instantiates a dataset. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a dataset please see Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Dataset.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the dataset to request.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.all
params.description: Whether to list all datasets, including hidden ones. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per page.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the dataset to create.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: The available options for metadata are outlined at the Dataset Resource API docs

params.name: value
params.description: The bytes value.

params.name: value
params.description: The date value.

methods.name: int64
methods.description: Create an Int64 object. This can be used to work with 64 bit integers as a string value while on a 32 bit platform.

params.name: value
params.description: The 64 bit integer value in string format.

params.name: value
params.description: The time value.

params.name: value
params.description: The timestamp value.

methods.name: buildJobConfig
methods.description:
Builds a configuration for a job.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait
